moving

Class Button

  • java.lang.Object
    • moving.Button

  • public class Button
extends java.lang.Object
    A clickable button. We created our own button class so that we could customize how it looked.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      boolean pressed

    • Field Detail

      • pressed

        public boolean pressed

    • Constructor Detail

      • Button

        public Button(int xPos,
      int yPos,
      int buttonWidth,
      int buttonHeight,
      java.lang.String btnText,
      java.awt.Color c,
      java.lang.String ID)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The x-position of the button.
        yPos - The x-position of the button.
        buttonWidth - The button's width
        buttonHeight - The button's height
        btnText - The text that will display on the button.
        c - The Color of the button
        ID - The ID of the button, which usually is the same as the name. This will allow you to distinguish between two buttons that have the same name, but do different things (such as the level up points buttons).

    • Method Detail

      • updateButton

        public void updateButton()
        Updates the button's position.

      • drawButton

        public void drawButton(java.awt.Graphics gg)
        Draws the button.
        Parameters:
        gg - The object on which to draw the graphics.

      • hits

        public boolean hits(int x,
           int y)
        Checks to see if the given location hits this button.
        Parameters:
        x - The x value of the test location.
        y - The y value of the test location.
        Returns:
        Whether the test location hits this button.

      • getCoord

        public java.awt.Point getCoord()
        Fetches the location of this button.
        Returns:
        A point representing the position of the button.

      • setCoord

        public void setCoord(int newX,
            int newY)
        Sets the button's location to the new given values.
        Parameters:
        newX - The new x coordinate
        newY - The new y coordinate

      • getID

        public java.lang.String getID()
        Fetches the ID of the button.
